bibl.title: Despatch Ranaralomanjaka
Despatches from United States Consuls in Boma, 1888-1895
bibl.publisher: National Archives and Records Service General Services Administration

div1.p:
Ranaralomanjaka III, by the Grace of God and His Will of the People, Queen of Madagascar and Defendor of the Law of the Country, + + + to our most distinguished Friend. His Excellency the President of the United States of Americas, sendeth greeting! It is with much pain that we have to announce to your Excellency the most lamented loss we and the Madagascar people experience in the death of Her Majesty Ranaralona II which took place on the 10th Alohotsy (13th July) afterlong severe illnes. By Her case Majesty's order given out during Her Reign and by the consent of the people we succeed Her as-- Queen of Madagascar. We assure your Exce- llency that our earnest desire is to be in good friendship with you and that our subjects and the American Citizens hold a friendly relation thereby to increase Commerce and promote civic . The Treaties of Peace and Commerce which exist between our respective countries remain unchanged. Given at our Court Massan dro, on the 18th Alohosy (21st july), in the year of our Lord, and in the first year of our reign
Your good friend (Signed) Ranaralomanjaka
